Articles.Content: I'm using the version of the RSS mod that rescales the Kerbin system 10x to a realistic size, but keeps their position, essentially creating a realistic Kerbin system. With this mod, how would I calculate the necessary delta v for trips to moons and other planets?
Check the RSS thread, there's a delta-V map floating around. I also know that NathanKell forked Alex Moon's launch window planner, not sure if his version is available anywhere.
Thanks, however, I'm not looking for the RSS map. I'm using a version of that mod that rescales the Kerbin system ,instead of replacing it with the solar system

Ah, well, no one has done a delta-V map for that, AFAIK. You can download a copy of Alex Moon's launch planner and edit the planetary values yourself... Alternatively you can make a delta-V map for yourself based on the values in the config file.
The latter is what I'm wanting to do, but I'm not clear on how to do it. Can you advise?
I'm looking at the Alex Moon planner, and it looks good, but it doesn't seem to support trips to moons. Is that right?

I'm looking at the Alex Moon planner, and it looks good, but it doesn't seem to support trips to moons. Is that right?

It supports trips from one moon to another within the same SOI (Mun to Minmus, Tylo to Pol, for instance). Beyond that I don't really have that much to offer. You might want to look into how a delta-V map is generated, all of the information you need is available.

Well, I also downloaded this mod but instead using the forum for DV, I Scott manly videos

and the second:
and some physic that I learn in school for the task.

I calculated that without fraction you need 9300 DV to 110-110 orbit, so total of 9500-10000 for orbit.

eldar158

I downloaded a copy of Alex Moon's planner, how do I edit the values for the planets and Kerbol?

thanks
